Class Room

java.lang.Object
fr.tp.inf112.projects.robotsim.model.Component
fr.tp.inf112.projects.robotsim.model.Room
All Implemented Interfaces:
Figure, Visitable, Serializable
public class Room extends Component
Represents a room in the robot simulation. A room can contain Doors and is part of a Factory.

The room's behavior includes checking if a position is on its border and managing its associated Doors. Borders of a room are considered obstacles.

See Also:

    • Room

      public Room(String name, int x, int y, int width, int height, Factory factory)
      Constructs a Room with specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the room.
      x - X-coordinate of the room's position.
      y - Y-coordinate of the room's position.
      width - Width of the room.
      height - Height of the room.
      factory - The Factory to which the room belongs.

  • Method Details

    • isOnBorder

      public boolean isOnBorder(int x, int y)
      Checks if a given position is on the border of the room.
      Parameters:
      x - X-coordinate of the position.
      y - Y-coordinate of the position.
      Returns:
      True if the position is on the border, false otherwise.

    • isOnBorder

      public boolean isOnBorder(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Checks if a rectangle with center at (x, y) and specified width and height is on the border of the room. This checks if any part of the rectangle, including its interior, is touching the border.
      Parameters:
      x - X-coordinate of the CENTER of the rectangle.
      y - Y-coordinate of the CENTER of the rectangle.
      width - Width of the rectangle.
      height - Height of the rectangle.
      Returns:
      True if any part of the rectangle or its interior is on the border, false otherwise.

    • isOnBorder

      public boolean isOnBorder(int x, int y, int size)
      Checks if a square with center at (x, y) and size is on the border of the room. This checks if any part of the square, including its interior, is touching the border.
      Parameters:
      x - X-coordinate of the CENTER of the square.
      y - Y-coordinate of the CENTER of the square.
      size - Length of the square's sides.
      Returns:
      True if any part of the square or its interior is on the border, false otherwise.
